Notes: Located in the baggage room of the  Atlanta, Birmingham, and Atlantic Railroad Depot built in 1902.Union and Confederate Civil War weapons; Civil War drum used in parades in Fitzgerald; memorabilia of early years of this unique city;  collection of late 19th and early 20th century photographs, quilts, clothing, etc.;  World War I and World War II uniforms.  Cotton mill artifacts which help relate the 1900-1971 history of the factory.  Five changing exhibit areas.  Some artifacts from the estate of Confederate President Jefferson Davis.Video relates the eventful founding story of Fitzgerald.  Train caboose available for viewing.
